title: The Baptist Generals - Dog [1998][MP3 / V0 (VBR)]
description:
Artist:The Baptist Generals
Release:Dog 
Released: 1998
Label: Quality Park Records
Catalog#: QPR003CD
Format: MP3 / V0 (VBR)
Country: USA
Style:Alternative/Indie Rock,Lo-Fi

Flemmons finds truth and beauty in the trad-rock form, meaning he performs and records like a man who's never heard of the Beatles...or, for that matter, electricity. Funny how the backward-glancers have become the most 'visionary' among us in these most desperate times; we revere those for whom there's a past beyond tomorrow, and Flemmons is nothing if not the most backward among the Denton rock crowd -- and that's the ultimate compliment. Dog is a gawldang throwdown and God-bless comedown, a CD that belongs on acetate in the Library of Congress basement-tapes archives. 'Pats the Rub' may well be the stompingest song you'll hear (or, likely, not) all year, and its follow-up, 'Evergone,' may be the saddest, especially when the thirtysomething Flemmons starts crooning like a 90-year-old man oooohing his last breath. At first, I thought Dog sounded like something recorded on a front porch; upon further inspection, more likely it was just found in a ditch, at the end of the rainbow." - Dallas Observer

01	 2/3rds Jim's Head	
02	 Pats The Rub	
03	 Sole, Spirit, Ghost	
04	 Wash Sheets / Walls Of Blood	
05	 Wrath You	
06	 Evergone	
07	 Goat Driver	
08	 Blue Suit Tobacco
